q: Republican U.S. Dick Armey Mike Pence made the rounds at the Indiana Statehouse on Tuesday. office, delivered a speech in both the Indiana House and Senate chambers, and then spoke with news media. I would say our options we're considering and we're reflecting on are to either continue to serve in Washington in some capacity, to come home to Indiana to seek higher office or to seek higher office on the national level, Mike Pence told reporters. Indiana Republicans have said in recent weeks that they believe Mike Pence will run for governor, in part because the office could serve as a better springboard for a national campaign than a U.S.

Google is the second tech giant in less than a week to surprise investors with a CEO change. The space can support multiple players. But the bar you have to meet in terms of your ecosystem is very high. Even Google has lagged to some degree here. Last fall, when asked about what he wants to improve the most about Android, CEO Eric Schmidt responded that he wanted to improve the quality of the applications.
